New Records: Emmanuel Rivera hit 2 home runs and drove in 4 runs in the same game, a feat he achieved for the first time in his career.
Key Match Events: Ryan O'Hearn hit a 2-run home run in the first inning
Emmanuel Rivera drove a slider from Zebby Matthews into the bullpens in left-center to extend the Baltimore lead to 4-0 in the second inning
Rivera added a double in the third, a solo homer in the fifth and a single in the ninth for the first four-hit game of his career.
Ryan Jeffers helped the Twins avoid the shutout with a two-run homer with two outs in the ninth.
Pre-Game Insights: The Orioles have clinched the top wild card in the American League and will face either the Kansas City Royals or Detroit Tigers in the first round of the playoffs.
The Twins have lost six of their last seven and were eliminated from playoff contention on Friday.
Post-Match Reflections: Orioles manager Brandon Hyde expressed his encouragement with how his team is playing going into the postseason.
Twins manager Rocco Baldelli said Matthews would be a candidate for the Twins rotation next spring.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Baltimore used Matt Bowman as its opener and he got the first four outs.
Lefty Tucker Davidson (1-0), making his first appearance for the Orioles after spending the season in Triple-A, allowed four hits over 4 2/3 shutout innings to earn the victory.
Others: The Twins will start RHP Bailey Ober (12-8, 3.94) in Sunday’s season finale.
The Orioles will send RHP Albert Suárez (8-7, 3.74) to the mound for his final tune-up before the postseason.
